sentences.en: Hunting has become institutionalized, i . e . one has to obtain a licence before he goes hunting.
sentences.cn: 打猎有规章限制,必须事先申请执照.

sentences.en: More and more of our savings are institutionalized rather than individualized.
sentences.cn: 我们的储蓄越来越多地由个人手里转入各种组织的控制中.

sentences.en: My mother's mother, fatally ill tubercular infection, fell into a suicidal depression and was institutionalized.
sentences.cn: 外祖母染上了致命的肺病, 心情抑郁,整天闹着要自杀,最后被送进精神病院.

sentences.en: She saw herself as a failure and had been institutionalized once for depression.
sentences.cn: 她认为自己是个失败者，曾有一次因患抑郁症被送往精神病院治疗。

sentences.en: The people who want to institutionalized may be attempting to bring you back down to reality.
sentences.cn: 那些想把你送入精神病院的人可能是想把你带回现实.

sentences.en: This inferiority complex has been institutionalized in the Chinese mind.
sentences.cn: 这种自卑情结成为中国内心的一部分.

words.tran_cn: 制度；建立；（社会或宗教等）公共机构；习俗
使成惯例的；有组织的；遭受收容机构所产生的不良影响的

trans.tran_cn: 约定俗成的；成惯例的,（因长期生活在福利机构）缺乏自理能力的
trans.tran_en: forming part of a society or system

trans.tran_cn: 使（某事物）制度化( institutionalize的过去式和过去分词)，将（某人）收容在社会福利机构
